You approach the villagers and ask what’s going on. They start peppering you with stories of how their farms are being raided by a group of bandits that seem to have taken residence in the area. When you offer to look into it, they promise to give you a reward if you can put a stop to the attacks.

You walk over to the old man and ask about his granddaughter being missing. He seems a little nervous to be talking to a mage, but answers you.

[color=yellow]—Well, $sir, my granddaughter Tia was out picking berries in the wilds yesterday and she didn’t come home like she was supposed to. When I went out to go look for her, I found her basket but there was no sign of her. Please $sir, with all the recent attacks I’m worried that she got taken by a group of bandits. If you can find her I can’t tell you how grateful I’d be. She’s just a sweet young thing and I don’t want to think of what might happen to her.[/color]

You ask him to tell you where he found her basket and he describes the location to you.

After considering what you’ve found out from the old man and the villagers you decide to see if you can track down this group of bandits.

caliQuestTexts.CaliBarEntrance:
You decide to visit a local bar in attempt to find some clues about Cali's origins. After a few minutes of casual talk the barkeeper points you in a few directions. Following them leads you to one ruthless looking man who seems to deal in slave trafficking, however Cali does not recognize him. You decide to talk to him directly. After a brief introduction he tells you to call him Jason.

[color=yellow]— Halfkin slavers? Well, I could name a place or two, but what's in it for me? You seem to be in a rush though and I think I know exactly who you would be looking for. [/color]

Telling him to get to the point, he proposes a deal.

[color=yellow]— 500 gold. Semi-legal slavers have their own fears and who knows;  you might be one of those Militia dogs sniffing out an easy promotion. Or... — He gives Cali a dirty look, making her feel uncomfortable. — I wouldn't mind having some fun with your girl, she's pretty cute and I really like that rebellious look. Obviously she wouldn't be worth this much, but that would be enough proof of your good will, right? I'll tell you what you want for 100 gold then. [/color]
caliQuestTexts.CaliBarRepeat:
You enter the same bar and find your previous acquaintance slowly drinking at one of the tables. 

[color=yellow]— You again? Did you get the money? Remember, no money no info. Or did you persuade your girl for a discount? [/color]

Cali looks at Jason with uneasiness.
caliQuestTexts.CaliBarLastpay:
Jason meets you with a bored look. 

[color=yellow]— I still need those hundred gold. Have you got them?[/color]
caliQuestTexts.CaliBarPay500: [color=yellow]— Alright, the guys you are interested in can be found in a nearby village. Shaliq it was I believe? Just ask locals, they have been pretty active recently. [/color]
caliQuestTexts.CaliBarPay100: [color=yellow]— Alright, the guys you are interested in can be found in a nearby village. Shaliq it was I believe? Just ask locals, they have been pretty active recently. [/color]
caliQuestTexts.CaliBarLeave: You leave the Bar and head back onto the streets.
caliQuestTexts.CaliBarTalk: You take Cali into an isolated spot to discuss the situation.
caliQuestTexts.CaliBarForce:
You explain to Cali, that 400 gold is a huge sum of money you don't have on hand and it's essentially her duty to do anything she can to help find her parents. Having sex with this man is a small price for their well-being. 

After a long moment of silence she sighs and agrees with a pained look on her face. 

[color=yellow]— You are right... This is like a horrible dream. Fine, I'll do it.[/color]

With her confirmation you return to the mercenary.
caliQuestTexts.CaliBarDeny: As you drop the issue, Cali sighs with relief. There's likely some other ways to deal with Jason without involving her.
caliQuestTexts.CaliBarPersuadeSuccess:
You explain to Cali how you would like her to take this as an opportunity to learn new things and overcome her shyness. There should be no danger and they also get a nice bonus helping her own cause.

She's taken aback by your suggestion, but you notice some curiosity and budding lust in her eyes. 

[color=yellow]— Y-you think so? I... wouldn't want to do this, but if you want me... Alright. I will do it with him.[/color]

You smile back at her, satisfied with her decisiveness and prepare to return to the mercenary.
caliQuestTexts.CaliBarPersuadeFail: [color=yellow]— NO!! I won't stay alone with that man even for 1 minute! Why are you even suggesting this?? I can't believe you would want me to have sex with him![/color]
caliQuestTexts.CaliBarFuckUnwilling:
After passing Cali a contraception, you send them off to one of the Bar's private rooms. After what feels like a couple of hours they finally show up again. Jason wears a smug, satisfied grin, while Cali's face appears red from recent tears. You spot a couple of bruises on her body, indicating she probably tried to struggle.

[color=yellow]— She's nice and tight, but you should really discipline her better. Alright, 100 gold and I tell you everything you want. [/color]
caliQuestTexts.CaliBarFuckWilling:
After passing Cali a contraception, you send them off to one of the Bar's private rooms. After what feels like a couple of hours they finally show up again. Jason has a greatly satisfied look on his face. Cali looks fairly tired, disheveled and sways slightly while walking, but otherwise there's no uneasiness on her face. It seems they found a common language.

[color=yellow]— I haven't had such fun in quite a while, you got one amazing girl for her age, Pal. Ya know, keep the gold, I'll tell you what you want.[/color]

After getting the slaver camp location, you tell him goodbye and return back to the Mansion with Cali.
caliQuestTexts.CaliBarAskSebastian:
After describing your situation to Sebastian, you ask him if he could help somehow.

[color=yellow]— Oh, Jason, you say? Yes, yes, I know him. Pretty reliable guy when it comes to work, but he's not in the business just for money. You probably have figured it out already though. — He gives Cali a quick glance, — Well, I assume you came to me so the young lady wouldn't need to deal with something nasty like his offer. Truth to be told, he owes me a favor since the time I let him... well, you don't really need to know about that. 

— Take this note, he should recognize it and at least cut a hefty sum from his service. Oh, don't worry about it, after all you helped me before, and I expect us to have a profitable partnership in the future. It's a pleasure to forge a friendship with someone of your caliber![/color]

After taking the debt note from Sebastian, you leave and can visit Jason again.
caliQuestTexts.CaliBarUseSebastian:
After seeing the note Jason sighs heavily.

[color=yellow]— Oh... I guess debts really chase after you even if you forget them. Fine $name, 100 gold and I'll tell you everything. [/color]

After hearing this Cali is relieved, not worrying about having to deal with him anymore.
caliQuestTexts.CaliSlaversTaken:
As you look around the Crossroads, you notice what seems to be a collection of tents and cages, set back from the road a bit and fenced off, except for an opening guarded by a pair of rough-looking sentries. When you approach, their bored expressions vanish and they look at you with suspicion.

[color=yellow]— Hold up there. This is a private encampment, unless you have business here you should be on your way.[/color]

You tug a lead and Cali stumbles out from behind you, dressed in a scruffy tunic. Before coming here, you managed to convince her the only way you’d be taken seriously was if she really did look like a prisoner. She wasn’t exactly thrilled with the idea, but agreed as long as you made her bindings loose enough that she could slip out of them quickly.

Upon seeing the half-kin girl one of the sentries smirks, while the other starts looking bored again. You explain that you heard there was a slaver here that was interested in half-kin girls and wanted to see if you could make some gold.

[color=yellow]— Yeah, guess you heard right. Alright, show her to the boss. — He jerks a thumb behind him. — Look for the red tent near the center of the encampment.[/color]

You notice Cali bristling at the dismissive tone and shoot her a warning look before thanking the guard and heading in. Despite its small size, the encampment is crowded with tents and cages. You can hear the sounds of whips and screams in the background, and you can see Cali’s eyes widen as she sees a pair of half-kin catgirls naked and covered in welts in one of the nearby cages.

You finally manage to locate the red tent the guard mentioned and walk inside. You are immediately greeted by the sight of a corpulent man dressed in gaudy clothes, scribbling on some papers at a table.

[color=#ff4949]— What is it? I told you not to bother me again today![/color]

He doesn’t bother looking up. Clearing your throat, you try to get the man’s attention. After a minute the man looks up, seemingly surprised.

[color=#ff4949]— Huh, you’re not who I thought you were. Forget it, what’s your business with me?[/color]
caliQuestTexts.CaliSlaversLeft:
As you look around the Crossroads, you notice what seems to be a collection of tents and cages, set back from the road a bit and fenced off, except for an opening guarded by a pair of rough-looking sentries. When you approach, their bored expressions vanish and they look at you with suspicion.

[color=yellow]— Hold up there. This is a private encampment, unless you have business here you should be on your way.[/color]

You explain that you heard you might be able to purchase some exotic slaves here and wanted to see what was available. One of the sentries spits and looks away, clearly uninterested. The other one gives your clothing a measuring look and replies.

[color=yellow]— Maybe, but we don’t just let anyone in here. Unless you’ve got a token you’ll need to pay the entry fee. 100 gold.[/color]
caliQuestTexts.CaliSlaversPay:
The guard carefully counts out the money then jerks a thumb back towards the center of the camp.

[color=yellow]— You want to look for the red tent near the center. If you’re here to buy you’ll need to speak to the boss. He’s been in a foul mood lately though, so watch yourself.[/color]

As you enter the camp it’s clear this is a fairly large operation. There’s tents and cages throughout the cramped space and the sound of whips, cursing and screams fill the air. The smell isn’t exactly pleasant either and a quick glimpse at one of the cages shows one of the reasons. Inside is a young half-kin girl, huddled in a fetal position and covered in her own filth. Other cages have more of the same, the few occupants that dare meet your eyes look at you with fear.

You finally manage to locate the red tent the guard mentioned and walk inside. You are immediately greeted by the sight of a corpulent man dressed in gaudy clothes, scribbling on some papers at a table.

[color=#ff4949]— What is it? I told you not to bother me again today![/color]

He doesn’t bother looking up. Clearing your throat, you try to get the man’s attention. After a minute the man looks up, seemingly surprised.

[color=#ff4949]— Huh, you’re not who I thought you were. Forget it, what’s your business with me?[/color]
caliQuestTexts.CaliSlaversOffer:
The man notices Cali behind you and looks at her for a moment, then stands to walk around the table.

[color=#ff4949]— Oh, I see you brought one of those filthy half-breeds with you. Were you looking to sell her?[/color]

You shrug and tell him she’s been nothing but trouble and that you’d heard there was someone here that might find her worthwhile. Even though you’d warned Cali you might do this, she still seems a bit worried. Your trip through the camp must have made an impression on her.

The man steps closer, ponderously making his way around her. After a minute or two he nods to himself.

[color=#ff4949]— Well, she’s not much to look at. She seems like she has some spirit in her though, that might make her entertaining to break. If you want to sell her I suppose I could offer 350 gold for her.[/color]

You find the offer surprisingly good You’re sure that if you sold Cali at the slave market you’d get far less so this is actually a very good price.
caliQuestTexts.CaliSlaverSell:
When you agree to the offer, Cali looks shocked for a moment then starts to struggle with her bonds while shouting.

[color=yellow]— You fucking bastard, I knew I couldn’t trust you![/color]

You put a quick stop to her nonsense with a quick jerk to the lead running to her hands. She apparently never noticed the knot you tied was actually a slipknot, and your yank simultaneously draws the bindings tight and knocks her off balance. The slaver just watches with interest as you quickly subdue the struggling wolf-girl. After she’s been thoroughly hog-tied you tell the slaver to keep a close eye on her and that she’s already escaped from one set of captors before. The slaver just smiles, an evil glint in his eyes as he replies.

[color=#ff4949]— Oh, trust me, I know just how to deal with a girl like her. First I’ll spend some time beating her so she knows her place, then I’ll pass her around to be raped a few times. If any of my men aren’t pleased, she’ll be beaten again. Of course if it looks like she’s too badly injured, I’ll just have to heal her. After a few days she’ll be begging to please every man in the camp.[/color]

After you heard the man mention he’d heal her, you instinctively looked to see if the man was wearing a distinctive ring. Seeing it, you nod to yourself. The man counts up your gold from a small chest behind the table and hands it to you.

[color=#ff4949]— Ah, and if you’re ever in the market for an animal, stop by again. I may have something to interest you. Here, let me give you my token so that the guards know that you are welcome here.[/color]
caliQuestTexts.CaliSlaverNoSell:
You act as though you are considering the offer for a while before you shake your head and explain that you have a friend that had already expressed an interest and would likely pay you more. The Slaver looks at you with irritation. Before he can demand you leave and stop wasting his time you tell him that the main reason you wanted to see him was to inform him of a problem.

[color=#ff4949]— What do you mean I have a problem?[/color]

Despite his obvious irritation, your serious tone seems to have caught his attention. You explain that you had recently been by Shaliq village, where you overheard an interesting tidbit in the local inn. Over the next several minutes you weave together a convincing story that the residents of  Shaliq had caught several members of a bandit gang that had been raiding nearby farmsteads, and after questioning them they had claimed to be working for him.

[color=#ff4949]— What!? That’s ridiculous. I never ordered any attacks on farms, and I certainly have no interest in dealing with human girls.[/color]

After you explain that the captured bandits said their leader was supposedly here now making some kind of deal with him, his eyes widen in realization, then narrow in anger.

[color=#ff4949]— That incompetent bastard. First he fails to deliver on his quota, now he pulls this shit down on me!? I’ll have his balls in a vice for this.[/color]

You offer a solution, that if he tells you where you can find the bandit, you’ll take care of the problem for him. Provided, of course, he offers you some considerations in the future. You explain your plan, yet another layer to the deception, and wait for his answer. He thinks about it for a minute, beedy eyes narrowed in thought then nods.

[color=#ff4949]— That sounds like it would work. Of course if I find a lynch mob from Shaliq coming my way I’ll make sure you suffer for it. How about I give you a discount on buying slaves from me in the future? I’ll also give you a token to let the guards know you’re trusted here.[/color]

You act as though you’re considering the offer, then accept. He tells you where you can find the bandit’s leader, just a short way into the woods. As you exit the tent, Cali gives you a look of admiration for your artful deception, and after you’re past the guards she pumps her fist.

[color=yellow]— Yes! I can’t believe you pulled that off $name, that was awesome! Now all we gotta do is find the bandit boss, beat the crap outta him and find out where he found me.[/color]

Now all that remains is to get the information you need. You may search after the bandit now, or return to your mansion to prepare.
caliQuestTexts.CaliSlaversNoOffer:
[color=#ff4949]— Well, why didn’t you say so in the first place? Well, usually I’d be willing to sell, but at the moment all my stock is committed elsewhere. If those fools I hired were worth a damn I might have something to offer. As it is I’m afraid you’re out of luck.[/color]

Acting disappointed, you shrug then tell him there was another reason you came to visit besides taking a look at his selection. Seeing his interest, you explain that you found out about his operation by overhearing some talk in Shaliq Village, and that he may have a problem on his hands.

[color=#ff4949]— What do you mean I have a problem?[/color]

Despite his obvious irritation, your serious tone seems to have caught his attention. You explain that you had recently been by Shaliq village, where you overheard an interesting tidbit in the local inn. Over the next several minutes you weave together a convincing story that the residents of Shaliq had caught several members of a bandit gang that had been raiding nearby farmsteads, and after questioning them they had claimed to be working for him.

[color=#ff4949]— What!? That’s ridiculous. I never ordered any attacks on farms, and I certainly have no interest in kidnapping little human girls.[/color]

After you explain that the captured bandits said their leader was supposedly here now making some kind of deal with him, his eyes widen in realization, then narrow in anger.

[color=#ff4949]— That incompetent bastard. First he fails to deliver on his quota, now he pulls this shit down on me!? I’ll have his balls in a vice for this.[/color]

You offer a solution, that if he tells you where you can find the bandit, you’ll take care of the problem for him. Provided, of course, he offers you some considerations in the future. You explain your plan, yet another layer to the deception, and wait for his answer. He thinks about it for a minute, beedy eyes narrowed in thought then nods.

[color=#ff4949]— That sounds like it would work. Of course if I find a lynch mob from Shaliq coming my way I’ll make sure you suffer for it. How about I give you a discount on buying slaves from me in the future? I’ll also give you a token to let the guards know you’re trusted here.[/color]

You act as though you’re considering the offer, then accept. He tells you where you can find the bandit’s leader, just a short way into the woods.

[color=#ff4949]— Make sure to stop back after you’ve handled that problem for me. I’ll cut you a good deal on a new pet.[/color]
caliQuestTexts.CaliSlaversFightWinTogether:
In short order Cali has the slaver beaten within an inch of his life and restrained. It doesn’t take long for him to reveal the bandit you’re looking for is nearby, having set up a tent in the woods by the crossroads. Cali knocks him out afterwards and you carefully rebind her and lead her out of the slaver’s camp.

[color=yellow]— Yes! I can’t believe we pulled that off $name. Now all we gotta do is find the bandit boss, beat the crap outta him and find out where he found me.[/color]

You may search for the bandit leader now, or return to your mansion to prepare.
caliQuestTexts.CaliSlaversFightWinWithout: In short order you have the slaver beaten within an inch of his life and restrained. It doesn’t take long for him to reveal the bandit you’re looking for is nearby, having set up a tent in the woods by the crossroads. You knock him out afterwards and you quickly make your way out of the encampment.
caliQuestTexts.CaliStrayBanditFind:
As Cali and you approach the small camp, she becomes visibly excited at the prospect of finally finding out some information that might lead her to her home. You manage to get a view of the bandit without being seen, and Cali gives you a confident nod.

[color=yellow]— Yeah, that’s him. There’s no way I’d forget that ugly face. C’mon, let’s get this over with.[/color]
caliQuestTexts.CaliStrayBanditWin: After Cali managed to beat the bandit to within an inch of his life, you begin questioning him. You manage to find out a number of things,including where he stashed his loot. Most importantly though, he eventually tells you that he found Cali wandering several miles north of the [color=green]Far Eerie woods[/color]. Worryingly though, he tells the two of you that the area had been picked out for additional raids recently. After scouring the camp for valuables, you set off.
caliQuestTexts.CaliBadEnd:
You barely manage to keep up with Cali as she darts through the undergrowth. As you enter a clearing though, Cali suddenly stops.

[color=yellow]— Mom? Dad? Is...is anyone here?[/color]

The reason for Cali’s frightened voice and shocked expression is pretty clear. Just within the clearing lay the burned-out wreckage of what used to be a small home. Knowing what she’s likely to find, you slowly walk around the clearing while Cali frantically pulls at the burnt timbers. You aren’t surprised when your exploration of the clearing reveals a pair of corpses. One is that of a male beastkin wolf, while the other is a human woman. You sigh, then call out to Cali. As she comes up to where you’re examining the bodies, her eyes widen.

[color=yellow]— Oh no...I…I was too late. Why? I tried so hard, they...they can’t really be dead can they?[/color]
caliQuestTexts.CaliBadEndComfort:
You step forward and silently put your arms around her. After a moment she turns to you and starts crying, burying her face in your chest.

[color=yellow]— Why? I...I tried so hard to come home. Why did they have to die?[/color]

You just stroke her head until she finally stops crying. It’s a shame you couldn’t get here sooner, but what’s done is done.

Eventually, she looks up at you, eyes puffy from crying.

[color=yellow]— I...what do I do now? They’re dead and I’m….I’m all alone now.[/color]

You consider the matter. At this point she’s particularly vulnerable to your suggestions and there are a number of things you could do with her.
caliQuestTexts.CaliBadEndStay:
There’s little to be done in a situation like this. You step back a bit and wait, watching as she extolls her parents to get up. Finally, the truth sinks in and she collapses, sobbing from the bottom of her heat as she admits to the fact of her parent’s deaths.

Eventually, she looks up at you, eyes puffy from crying.

[color=yellow]— I...what do I do now? They’re dead and I’m….I’m all alone now.[/color]

You consider the matter. At this point she’s particularly vulnerable to your suggestions and there are a number of things you could do with her.
caliQuestTexts.CaliStay:
You tell her that it’s fine and that she can stay with you for as long as she wants. She gives you a grateful look, then scrubs her eyes.

After several hours you bury her parents and return to the mansion. It may not have been a happy conclusion, but Cali seems to appreciate what you’ve done for her. After the death of her parents, she appears to have lost some of her confidence and assertiveness, but her faith in you has grown a lot and she seems willing to do whatever you ask of her.
caliQuestTexts.CaliSlave:
You think for a while, while Cali seems to grow more nervous. Finally you tell her that if she is willing to swear absolute servitude to you, you’ll consider it. If she promises that she will be obedient, won’t cause any trouble and will do anything you ask of her, you will offer her a place in your household. She swallows, then nods.[color=yellow]— I’ll be a good servant...$master.[/color]

It may not have been a happy conclusion, but Cali seems to understand her place. After the death of her parents, she appears to have lost some of her confidence and assertiveness, becoming more passive than she used to be. She has become one of your more obedient servants, never forgetting that you are now her Master.
caliQuestTexts.CaliPlaythingSuccess:
You finger the Amnesia Potion you found in the bandit leader’s camp, then withdraw it. You tell Cali that if the pain is too much to bear, there’s something she could do. She listens, then looking over at the bodies she nods.

[color=yellow]— I...if it will make me forget all this. I’ll do it. From the beginning I guess I was just going to end up as someone’s plaything. I’d rather it be you than someone else. Just...promise you won’t throw me away.[/color]

You nod and Cali takes the potion from you. Closing her eyes she drinks the potion down in a rush. As she opens her eyes, the empty bottle slips from her fingers to the grass below. Her empty eyes and blank expression are all you need to confirm the impact of the potion.

[color=yellow]— Who are you?[/color]

You explain that you are her Master and that she belongs to you.

[color=yellow]— What are we doing here Master?[/color]Smiling, you take her hand and lead her away from the corpses. While you walk, you explain that you brought her out here to explain her duties and teach her what pleases you. After you are a ways away, you tell her to remove her clothing, to which she immediately complies. As she stands naked before you, you tell her her sole purpose in life is to bring you pleasure with her body. For the next several hours you instruct her in how to pleasure you with her hands and mouth, with her pussy and her ass, until her body is stained with your semen and your seed trickles down her thighs. 

Cali is left a broken mess, more animal than human. Nothing remains of her old personality and all she knows is how to serve her master with her body.
caliQuestTexts.CaliPlaythingFailure:
She looks at you in shock and revulsion.

[color=yellow]— My parents are dead and you...you want me to become your plaything?[/color]

Without another word she takes off, never looking back. You shrug as she disappears into the woods. It’s a shame, but she was never that loyal to begin with. You poke around the ruins for a time, hoping to find something the bandits left behind. Pocketing the few trinkets you happen across, you return to your mansion.
caliQuestTexts.CaliLeave: You look around the scene. The burned house, the dead bodies of her parents and the half-kin girl you spent all this effort for. At that moment you decide it. That’s it. You’re done. You did what you said you would and helped Cali find her parents. It’s not your fault they’re dead and you’ve wasted enough time and effort already. Without saying another word, you leave the girl to her own devices. She can be a thief or a whore for all you care. All you know is that your part in this is over.
caliQuestTexts.CaliGoodEnd:
As you approach a clearing in the forest you come across a lone house. Apparently Cali has been already spotted by her parents, as two figures leave the building and rush to the returning girl. A beastkin male and human female with which Cali share some resemblance. 

[color=aqua]— Cali! You’re alive, thank the gods! We thought we’d lost you.[/color]

As they finally gather and reach each other, the three of them share a long hug. After they part, the man looks at you, then back to Cali.

[color=aqua]— So Cali, who’s this person?[/color]

Cali looks over at you and grins, tail wagging furiously.

[color=yellow]Mom, Dad, this is $name. $He’s been letting me stay at $his mansion and $he helped me find my way back.[/color]

The man and woman both give you an appraising look. After a moment, the woman raises an eyebrow and looks at Cali.

[color=green]— So you’ve been taking care of our daughter? I hope she hasn’t been too much trouble.[/color]

You assure her that Cali’s been fine, and proceed to explain all that’s happened while Cali was missing. Both of her parents seem impressed, and pleased that you managed to help her find her way home.

[color=aqua]— That’s quite the tale. Escaping from slavers, being rescued from the city guards, then managing to track us down after taking out an entire gang of bandits. Not to mention getting here just in the nick of time. Is there anything we can do to repay you?[/color]
caliQuestTexts.CaliGoodEndNoReward: You shake your head and explain that you were just keeping your promise. Seeing Cali reunited with her family is reward enough. Her parents seem impressed with your probity and tell you that if there’s anything their family can do for you in the future, all you need to do is ask. You leave Cali and her family to clean up from the bandit’s attack and feel a sense of satisfaction from a good deed accomplished.
caliQuestTexts.CaliGoodEndNoRewardReturn:
It’s been a week since you returned Cali to her parents, and as you settle in for the night you think about the young half-kin girl. Sure, she might not have been the most beautiful girl you’ve met, but she was brave, hardworking and outspoken, traits that are all too uncommon. Suddenly you hear a bit of a commotion from downstairs. You head down, then blink in surprise.

[color=yellow]— Um...hi $name. I was wondering, well...It’s just...I mean, I talked to my parents about it and...Argh! Why is this so hard![/color]Cali takes a deep breath then meets your eyes squarely.

[color=yellow]— I think I love you, $name and I want to stay with you. I don’t mind being your servant, or even your slave. I know I’m not very experienced, but I’ll do anything you ask me to. I’ll fight for you, or gather food or...or bear children for you. Please...just let me stay with you.[/color]

You smile and ruffle the hair on Cali’s head. You’re glad she’s back and tell her so. As Cali follows you back up to your room, you grin. After all, she did say she’d do anything.
caliQuestTexts.CaliGoodEndReward:
You tell Cali’s parents that if they really want to reward you, anything would be fine. After all, you were mainly doing this as a favor to Cali. It’s not like you expected a reward. After some consultation amongst themselves Cali’s mother goes into the house. A few minutes later she returns.

[color=green]— I know it’s not much after what you’ve gone through, but here.[/color]

She hands you a small case. Inside is a number of carefully labeled potions.

[color=green]— My father was an alchemist and he left me with a number of useful potions. Maybe these can be of use to you.[/color]

You thank her, and give Cali’s hair a ruffle. When you get home, you’ll take a look, but for now you just say your goodbyes. Cali and her mother both give you hugs, while her father shakes your hand and promises never to forget what you’ve done for them. When you eventually return to your mansion you inspect the potions Cali’s mother gave you. You can tell a couple of them are expired, but it’s actually a rather good assortment. There’s a couple of stimulant potions, three tonics of hair growth, an elixir of youth and perhaps most impressively, a potion of oblivion. You’ll miss having Cali around, but are pleased that you could manage to keep your promise to her.
caliQuestTexts.CaliGoodEndKeep:
You think to yourself for a while. You’re happy that Cali was reunited with her family, but will miss having her services in the mansion. Despite her snark, she was actually pretty useful to have around. Nodding to yourself you ask if they would mind if Cali continued to work for you. amberguardQuestTexts.AmberguardLog1:
[center]Guard Officer Log[/center]
Within the ruins of an old watchtower you find the burnt remains of a journal. Most of the pages crumble at your touch. Of those that remain only a few remain comprehensible.

5pm. The recon team has just returned from their mission. Surprisingly, they seem to be eager to make their report. After leaving their horses in the stables, they quickly made their way to the central command. Hopefully, today's mission has born fruit.

6:45 pm.The enemy has been spotted around the city's outskirts. An unusually swift attack by them has been stopped by the numerous traps placed around the town. There is no sign of them giving up and more attacks are expected at any time.I sent a request for immediate support and yet another one few minutes ago, but I'm afraid we won't be able to hold for long.

6:00 am. The assault has continued throughout the night, we received reinforcements in time allowing us to force the elves out from a breach and seal it. We may holdout still.
amberguardQuestTexts.AmberguardLog2:
[center]City Commander Log[/center]
Today's mission is of utmost importance, our recon team will be infiltrating the enemy's latest research lab. Our  spies report that there is potentially a vital piece of research that may change the balance of the war. They also provided a one-chance route to get in and retrieve it with relative safety. I can only hope this is not a trap, but the reward far outweighs the risk. This war has been going on long enough and any potential breakthrough will help to save thousands of lives.

…

The recon team has returned a couple of minutes ago, I've sent them directly to the Order. As usual the elves have been extremely cautious and protected their discoveries with magic, but it shouldn't be a problem for the Order's decryptors.

…

The Elves have attacked again and this time they came close to destroying the outer wall. The city has been surrounded, the elves moving in shortly after the first strikes. I've managed to send a messenger through their lines to the nearest town. Given how relentlessly they are proceeding with the siege, we may be able to hold out a few days at best. There's no doubt that this strike is retaliation for what we stole from them.

…

They are relentless, most would have retreated and settled in for an extended siege by now but they keep throwing bodies at the wall. They must be desperate to retrieve our findings. This gives us hope that what we have is even more vital to our survival than we thought.
amberguardQuestTexts.AmberguardLog3:
[center]Order Master Log[/center]
After all the setbacks we have faced, we’ve finally done it. We have in our hands the solution to ending the war. The Thaumic Obstructor can easily affect an area roughly a square mile and is especially effective against those who are magically gifted targets. It's ironic that they were the ones who designed this device. Once we get through the schematics’ encryption and defences, we'll be able to develop additional protection for ourselves and render whole squads of their troops ineffective.

It is clear enough that they are well aware that we were stole their schematics and are launching ferocious attacks against our outposts already. Thankfully we prepared for such, and as a result they have suffered a great number of casualties. It is vital that we pass on our findings to the other members of the Order and to the rest of humanity. As long as we have enough time, we should be able to get word out. 

Miraculously our walls still stand. Reports from the walls report the elves have retreated back to a safe distance but still surround the city. I do not for one minute think this is over. Too much is at stake.

mapleQuestTexts.MapleAudience:
After requesting an audience with the Host of the Slaver guild, you are lead through a pair of doors on the side of the receiving room and into an opulent office. You briefly introduce yourself. Upon hearing you wish to purchase Maple's contract, he seems a bit taken aback and gives you a surprised look. Composing himself, he explains that her whole upbringing and education has been on credit and now she's obliged to work off that debt in service to the guild. He pulls a file from his cabinet and lets you examine the contract. You realise that the contract was made before she was even old enough to make a reasonable informed decision. While the contract conditions may seem harsh, they most likely saved her from a life on the streets and no education to build a future upon.

The total sum left to pay is nearly 4800 gold, and judging by Maple's income, it would take more than a decade for her to pay off the rest of it. She's not technically a slave, but she might as well be. Seeing your gloomed expression, the Host tells you that since she's a diligent worker, and a popular guide, her leaving would be a big loss for guild plus he would have to train a new guide... However, a large bag of gold at hand would be rather useful and allow for expansion. Given your patronage and hopefully further support as well as being a respected person, he offers to sell you the contract for 7000 gold.

plotSceneTexts.garthorscene1:
Garthor, after checking to see that he was not followed, enters one of the small houses. A tall, hooded man inside greets him and begins speaking:

[color=aqua]— Now that the dark elf tribe has lost their leader, you should have no problem taking control. Considering this, I expect a favorable outcome from you.[/color]

[color=yellow]— Indeed, for us, that was a lucky outcome. My clan's troops will soon push them out and their riches will then benefit us. Some members of The Palace are already opening up to me.[/color]

[color=aqua]— Don't be too reckless. The other clans will act swiftly if they  ascertain your goals. If open confrontation occurs, we will not be able to assist you and death will find you swiftly.[/color]

[color=aqua]— Regardless, things are going well. As a bonus, you will receive ten more slaves in addition to the previously established amount. Just make sure they remain away from the public eye to avoid any unnecessary questions. After all, you do have a good reputation to upkeep.[/color]

The man stealthily grins at the irony and observes how Garthor's mood improves.

[color=yellow]— That's a very acceptable gift! We have a new plantation and mine which are still not fully operational. So, those orcs will be of great use.[/color]
plotSceneTexts.garthorscene3:
As the conversation finishes, the hooded man moves to the roof where he surveys the colorful, crowded streets below.

[color=aqua]— Useful tools indeed..[/color]
plotSceneTexts.hadepast1:
1x years ago…

[color=aqua]— as my research has proven, enslaved individuals from non-human races perform distinctively better and are much more subservient.[/color]

As the auditorium grew restless, the presenting magister calmly dismissed Hade before summoning the next speaker. As Hade returned to his seat, the other students gathered around him. One of his friends addressed him with a smile.

[color=green]— How can you be so bold? Half of the audience are non-humans, yet you present such things?![/color]

[color=aqua]— I merely produced my findings. If they can't accept scientific observations, that’s their fault.[/color]
plotSceneTexts.hadepast2:
[color=yellow]— That is ridiculous! Are you suggesting we expel anyone who is not human from The Order as well?! — A halfkin girl approached Hade with clear exhibition of disgust on her face, — You must be out of your mind?! You should be expelled for displaying such fictitious bias.[/color]

[color=aqua]— Science doesn't see prejudice. I merely showed clear evidence of a more efficient way to utilize the slave labor trade, to solve our labor shortage, with little risk to our society as a whole. If you disagree with my work then research it on your own.[/color]

[color=yellow]— Brilliant, let's just repeat what caused The Old War. It’s a relief that The Main Order won't consider your bullshit. You'd make a great Almar.[/color]

Hade made an effort to conceal his rising anger, and quickly returned the insult.

[color=aqua]— Louise, you don't have to be so upset that you aren’t part of the human race. If only you could go back and tell your mother not to fuck animals.[/color]

After seeing the appalled look on the halfkin girl's face, Hade satisfyingly grinned. Quickly after he left the room. He had no other interests in the other speakers. The Order might not acknowledge the benefits of his ideas, but he knew he was on the right track. To him, his ideas always rewarded the effort…
plotSceneTexts.hadepast3:
Hade stood over, what once was, his life’s work. His research now nothing but a pile of ash. While he was away, at dinner, someone broke into his dorm. Even though his room looked like a hurricane went through, his research was the culprit’s only target. He knew exactly who to blame and he soon found a group of students, led by Louise.

[color=aqua]— You bitch, I know it was you! You will pay for this.[/color]

They played the innocent card as they poorly masked their joy.

[color=yellow]—What are you  talking about?! Someone destroyed your vulgar research?! I should thank them for it, should I ever find them.[/color]

[color=aqua]— Just wait till I report this to the headmaster, foul halfbreeds![/color]

Engulfed in a rage, Hade leaves the group as he rushes to the headmaster.
plotSceneTexts.hadepast4:
Despite his best effort, The Order turned a blind eye.

[color=green]— Leave it Hade. Even if your research wasn't destroyed, it would have never gained ground. The truth is, The Order has an unconditional policy to never get involved in racial controversy. Your work would just be ignored by the Council and all you would receive is more hate from others. Find another use for your passions.[/color]

The headmaster's words struck Hade, but it made no impact on his thoughts. After a couple of moments, he finally replied.

[color=aqua]— I see now…[/color]

As he left the headmaster, no other member of the school would see him enter or leave his room. Unable to forgive the other students and the authorities, he disappeared the next morning.
plotSceneTexts.slaverguild:
A meeting of several slaver guilds across The Empire's central region has began shortly. The huge conference room had about a dozen of highest members in it.

[color=yellow]— Gentlemen, I think it's about time we address the growing conflict with The Order that has been developing over the last decade. With the recent slavery law changes, it's obvious The Order is aiming to crush our trade.[/color]

The room fills with anxious gibbering.

[color=aqua]— We should've foreseen and acted on this long ago. I had personally suggested we started switching wheels three years ago, but most of you are too absorbed into your gold to think about anything but drool over your gold piles. — a younger member brazenly spoke up[/color]

[color=green]— Shut it! Why would we willingly abandon what made us so powerful in first place? No other business is on the same level of profitability and you know it.[/color]
plotSceneTexts.slaverguild2:
After a couple more minutes, one of the quieter members stood up, requesting attention.

[color=aqua]— Gentlemen, I'm about to propose a solution. Recently, I've discovered a small group of people, led by a certain ex member of The Order. It is he who seems quite willing to oppose the current hierarchy in The Order. I've listened to his ideas and they seem to parallel ours…[/color]

[color=yellow]— Are you suggesting we topple The Order? That's absurdly reckless. Could you imagine the repercussions should we fail?[/color]

[color=aqua]— Indeed, I have. My contact also sees the risk. However, why destroy The Order, if we can instead replace the leadership? Regardless, his activity could slow down any political reforms they have in the works. If we sponsor my contact’s organization, we could redirect his goals. With our money, power, and the many relatives already in the vicinity of the Main Order, it wouldn't be hard to perform a coup.[/color]

Upon hearing these words the room fell silent. Many members began to carefully think it over…

[color=aqua]— This is great news indeed! With his removal, Frostford will draw the gaze of the council. With a few more touches, we can proceed.[/color]

plotSceneTexts.hademelissaend:
In the middle of the night desert, two figures shared a campfire with no other soul for miles around. Hade seems completely unfocused and disinterested in his meal. Melissa observes her brother closely, recalling the day he made contact with her. She had no idea she had a living relative, especially a sibling. He supported her promotion from mere slave to the Order's secretary. This gave her a reason to continue. Now, all that is in the past.

[color=aqua]— You should've left me for dead! My failures deserve no place in this world![/color]

These were the first words he spoke after they vacated the capital. Melissa said nothing in response. She knew that Hade would be depressed and was prepared for such behavior. They are outcasts now. However, she had made preparations beforehand, in case of such a failure. It was a small, rural house far from The Order's eyes. She didn't expect Hade would recover and revert to his prior state. Regardless, she did not regret her decisions. A quiet life would be suitable enough.
plotSceneTexts.undercitybookenc:
As you carefully make your way through the damp and rubble clogged tunnels, a small glint catches your attention. Upon closer inspection, you discover an old wood and metal door set into the stone. Despite its age and apparent wear, the door holds up pretty well in its frame. However, after a few moments of testing it, you find a weakness in the wood and push on into the space beyond. 

You stand in the ruins of what appears to be a private residence. Debris blocks most of the foyer, through which a small gap between walls reveals a navigable hallway. The narrow, high ceilinged corridor leads further into the ancient residence, revealing blocked passages that were once elegant rooms.

At the end of the corridor you discover what was once a grand library, shelves towering into the two-storied room. Though no doubt once filled with precious tomes of knowledge, now the shelves are lined with rotting leather and the heavy stench of mildew. As you scrape your boot against piles on the floor, looking in vain for something of interest, your actions disturb something in the library.
plotSceneTexts.undercitybookafterabttle: As the beast lies dead before you, something near its body catches your eye. Warily, you pick up a thick leather book. Aside from some light scuffs and dirt, the tome appears to be perfectly fine. Magic must have kept it from suffering the same fate as the rest of the library.
plotSceneTexts.zoebookdiscover:

[color=yellow]—Hey, $name. Do you have a minute? [/color]

Zoe stands at your door, her eyes bright and ears perked in interest. You greet her and ask what’s going on.

Back at home I’ve had a book describing similar patterns. If i’m not mistaken, it was a book describing how there are other dimensions, different from ours and if that’s true, we might be able to connect to it somehow.[/color]

The way the young wolf girl is speaking, it’s clear she’s confident in her knowledge and very interested in your discovery. You yourself haven’t had time to look it over in great detail, but it's clearly in a fairly old script and very likely an advanced piece of magical text. 

[color=yellow]—If you'd let me, I can translate the book for you. It might hold all sorts of answers about the ancient past![/color]

You doubt there’s much harm in letting her see it, and it’s possible she can research the text for you as she says. However, you’re a little unsure of lending the book to the studious girl.
